# Inotropes {#sec-inotropes}

Inotropes are drugs that ↑ force and velocity of myocardial contraction, causing a primary ↑ SV and a secondary ↑ in CO and BP. Inotropes are divided based on their effect on SVR into:

* Standard inotropes\
Catecholamines (or derived), which act to ↑ cAMP.
* Inodilators\
Phosphodiesterase inhibitors. 

:::column-margin
Although we like to conceptually separate inotropes from @sec-vasopressors, there is substantial overlap in action between drugs in either class and the umbrella term *vasoactive* is a better fit.
:::

## Practice

* Goal is restoration of tissue perfusion\
Regular clinical assessment.
* Circulatory failure
* Invasive arterial monitoring
